definition: to offer respectfully/to consecrate/to dedicate/to devote
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
to offer/to present/to dedicate/to donate/to show/to put on display/worthy person (old)
tithing

sentences.english: So the king and all the children of Israel dedicated the house of the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 这样，王和以色列众民为耶和华的殿行奉献之礼。

sentences.english: Christian dedication and faithfulness in worshiping, studying the Word, receiving the sacrament.
sentences.chinese: 在做礼拜，学习圣经，领圣餐时基督徒的奉献和忠诚。

sentences.english: We admired him for his total commitment to Indian Liberation.
sentences.chinese: 我们因他为印度的解放事业所作的无私奉献而钦佩他。

sentences.english: Last year, the party celebrated at its office in Moulmein, only offering food to monks.
sentences.chinese: 去年，仅在毛淡棉的办公室庆祝，只提供奉献给和尚。

sentences.english: At that time aviation was still in its infancy.
sentences.chinese: 他的一生都奉献给了中国的航空事业。

sentences.english: One afternoon, a male devotee was chanting japa very loudly in the temple room.
sentences.chinese: 一天下午，一个男奉献者在庙堂里非常大声地念颂。

sentences.english: Mr. Yang Kehe is the management elite with foresight and dedicated spirit.
sentences.chinese: 远见卓识富有奉献精神的管理精英。

sentences.english: Regard them as holy, because they offer up the food of your God.
sentences.chinese: 所以你要使他成圣，因为他奉献你神的食物。

sentences.english: To dedicate a collective song to the fight against hunger in the world.
sentences.chinese: 为战胜世界饥饿的斗争奉献一首集体颂歌。

sentences.english: I will use their own youth and wisdom regretless contributing to the expensive unit.
sentences.chinese: 我将以自己的青春和智慧无悔地奉献给贵单位。

sentences.english: But be content with the oblation or tithes, which I have separated for their uses and necessities.
sentences.chinese: 因为他只借一次奉献，就永远使被圣化的人得以成全。

sentences.english: A delicious drink, a complete food, a New Year's tribute of our foodstuff factory.
sentences.chinese: 鲜美饮料，全能营养，本食品厂新年新奉献。

sentences.english: I have had my labor for my travail .
sentences.chinese: 我已把自己劳动奉献给艰苦的工作。

sentences.english: My dear devotees, Please accept my humble obeisances.
sentences.chinese: 我亲爱的奉献者们，请接受我卑微的顶拜。
它照亮了奉献者的内心。

sentences.english: They are Honor, Courage, and Commitment.
sentences.chinese: 它们是信用，勇气和奉献。

definition: to offer/to give (as tribute)/to devote (one's life)/to sacrifice (oneself)
to contribute/to dedicate/to devote/contribution/CL:個|个[ge4]
selfless/unselfish/disinterested/altruistic
to offer to God
to pay/to invest (energy or time in a friendship etc)
no complaints/to have no regrets
to compose (a piece of music)/(fig.) to create, by one's actions, a narrative (generally one that can be recounted with pride)
to commit one's energy to/to devote oneself to/to sacrifice one's life for/(coll.) (of a woman) to give one's virginity to
to practice/to put into practice
noble/lofty/refined/exquisite
to repay a favor/to give back/feedback
to sing the praises of/to extol/to eulogize
utterly sincere/wholly devoted
compassion/kindness/care for others/love/CL:片[pian4]/charity (bazaar, golf day etc)/heart (the symbol ♥)
to hold fast to/to stick to
wonderful/marvelous/brilliant
